content.text:
The `claude doctor` command failed due to a terminal compatibility issue. This is related to the interactive terminal interface not being fully supported in this environment. 

Try running `claude --help` instead to see available commands:

content.content:
Usage: claude [options] [command] [prompt]

Claude Code - starts an interactive session by default, use -p/--print for
non-interactive output

Arguments:
  prompt                           Your prompt

Options:
  -d, --debug                      Enable debug mode
  --verbose                        Override verbose mode setting from config
  -p, --print                      Print response and exit (useful for pipes)
  --output-format <format>         Output format (only works with --print):
                                   "text" (default), "json" (single result), or
                                   "stream-json" (realtime streaming) (choices:
                                   "text", "json", "stream-json")
  --input-format <format>          Input format (only works with --print):
                                   "text" (default), or "stream-json" (realtime
                                   streaming input) (choices: "text",
                                   "stream-json")
  --mcp-debug                      [DEPRECATED. Use --debug instead] Enable MCP
                                   debug mode (shows MCP server errors)
  --dangerously-skip-permissions   Bypass all permission checks. Recommended
                                   only for sandboxes with no internet access.
  --allowedTools <tools...>        Comma or space-separated list of tool names
                                   to allow (e.g. "Bash(git:*) Edit")
  --disallowedTools <tools...>     Comma or space-separated list of tool names
                                   to deny (e.g. "Bash(git:*) Edit")
  --mcp-config <file or string>    Load MCP servers from a JSON file or string
  --append-system-prompt <prompt>  Append a system prompt to the default system
                                   prompt
  --permission-mode <mode>         Permission mode to use for the session
                                   (choices: "acceptEdits",
                                   "bypassPermissions", "default", "plan")
  -c, --continue                   Continue the most recent conversation
  -r, --resume [sessionId]         Resume a conversation - provide a session ID
                                   or interactively select a conversation to
                                   resume
  --model <model>                  Model for the current session. Provide an
                                   alias for the latest model (e.g. 'sonnet' or
                                   'opus') or a model's full name (e.g.
                                   'claude-sonnet-4-20250514').
  --fallback-model <model>         Enable automatic fallback to specified model
                                   when default model is overloaded (only works
                                   with --print)
  --settings <file-or-json>        Path to a settings JSON file or a JSON
                                   string to load additional settings from
  --add-dir <directories...>       Additional directories to allow tool access
                                   to
  --ide                            Automatically connect to IDE on startup if
                                   exactly one valid IDE is available
  --strict-mcp-config              Only use MCP servers from --mcp-config,
                                   ignoring all other MCP configurations
  --session-id <uuid>              Use a specific session ID for the
                                   conversation (must be a valid UUID)
  -v, --version                    Output the version number
  -h, --help                       Display help for command

Commands:
  config                           Manage configuration (eg. claude config set
                                   -g theme dark)
  mcp                              Configure and manage MCP servers
  migrate-installer                Migrate from global npm installation to
                                   local installation
  setup-token                      Set up a long-lived authentication token
                                   (requires Claude subscription)
  doctor                           Check the health of your Claude Code
                                   auto-updater
  update                           Check for updates and install if available
  install [options] [target]       Install Claude Code native build. Use
                                   [target] to specify version (stable, latest,
                                   or specific version)

                                   conversation (must be a valid UUID)
  -v, --version                    Output the version number
  -h, --help                       Display help for command

Commands:
  config                           Manage configuration (eg. claude config set
                                   -g theme dark)
  mcp                              Configure and manage MCP servers
  migrate-installer                Migrate from global npm installation to
                                   local installation
  setup-token                      Set up a long-lived authentication token
                                   (requires Claude subscription)
  doctor                           Check the health of your Claude Code
                                   auto-updater
  update                           Check for updates and install if available
  install [options] [target]       Install Claude Code native build. Use
                                   [target] to specify version (stable, latest,
                                   or specific version)

content.text:
Claude Code is installed and working. The available commands include:
- `claude` (interactive session)
- `claude --print "your prompt"` (non-interactive)
- `claude config` (manage configuration)
- `claude setup-token` (authentication)
- `claude update` (check for updates)

The `doctor` command has terminal compatibility issues in this environment, but the CLI is functional.
Great! You're all set with Claude Code installed and ready to use. You can start an interactive session with just `claude` or use `claude --print "your question"` for quick responses.
Thanks! 🎉 Happy to help you get Claude Code up and running!
Yes, I'm designed to help with a wide range of coding tasks including debugging, implementing features, refactoring, code analysis, and working across many programming languages and frameworks.
Thanks! Feel free to ask if you need help with any coding tasks.

input.query: AI workflow automation tools 2025 comparison business process automation

content.content:
Web search results for query: "AI workflow automation tools 2025 comparison business process automation"

Links: [{"title":"Top 5 AI Workflow Automation Tools for 2025","url":"https://www.flowforma.com/blog/ai-workflow-automation-tools"},{"title":"Best AI Workflow Automation Tools (2025) | Whalesync","url":"https://www.whalesync.com/blog/best-ai-workflow-automation-tools-2025"},{"title":"The best AI productivity tools in 2025 | Zapier","url":"https://zapier.com/blog/best-ai-productivity-tools/"},{"title":"Enhance Productivity with the Top 17 AI Workflow Tools for 2025","url":"https://www.cflowapps.com/ai-workflow-tools/"},{"title":"15 Best AI workflow automation tools to automate tasks in 2025","url":"https://trengo.com/blog/best-ai-workflow-automation-tools"},{"title":"11 AI Workflow Tools to Supercharge the Way You Work | Moveworks","url":"https://www.moveworks.com/us/en/resources/blog/ai-workflow-tools-to-streamline-business-processes"},{"title":"The Future of Efficiency: Exploring AI Workflow Automation Tools for Smarter Business Operations","url":"https://www.cflowapps.com/ai-workflow-automation-tools/"},{"title":"Top 9 Workflow Automation Tools as of July 2025 | Shakudo","url":"https://www.shakudo.io/blog/top-9-workflow-automation-tools"},{"title":"How AI Workflow Automation is Transforming Businesses in 2025","url":"https://botpress.com/blog/ai-workflow-automation"},{"title":"Top 10 Workflow Automation Software & Tools as of July 2025","url":"https://www.bitcot.com/workflow-automation-software-tools/"}]

I've found comprehensive information about AI workflow automation tools and business process automation comparisons for 2025. Here's a summary of the key findings:

## Top AI Workflow Automation Tools for 2025

Based on the search results, several platforms are leading the AI workflow automation space in 2025:

### Leading Platforms:

**1. FlowForma**
FlowForma stands out as one of the top 5 AI workflow automation tools for 2025. It's designed for ease of use, enabling business users to create forms, design workflows, analyze data, and generate documents in one platform, with users able to build processes in minutes using its AI-powered Copilot, accelerating process automation up to ten times faster than traditional tools.

**2. Trengo**
Trengo leads the pack for 2025 after analyzing core features, real user feedback, and long-term success across industries, standing out with its advanced conversation management, smart AI-based routing, and a robust integration ecosystem.

**3. Lindy**
Lindy is a no-code platform that lets you create custom AI agents, known as "Lindies," to automate various business workflows, handling tasks such as scheduling meetings, managing emails, and providing customer support.

**4. Zapier**
Zapier is one of the easiest AI workflow automation platforms to get started with, connecting over 6,000 apps and letting you set up automated workflows called "Zaps". It now includes Copilot, an AI-powered assistant for building workflows using natural language, which can suggest Zap outlines, connect accounts, map data, and test each step.

**5. Relay**
Relay comes packed with unique features including web scraping and human-in-the-loop blocks, with AI blocks that include everything from transcribing audio to generating images with DALL-E.

### Market Growth and Adoption

Market research shows that AI workflow automation and AI tools adoption is expected to grow with a CAGR of 21.5%, with growth projected to go from $20.1 billion in 2023 to $78.6 billion by 2030. According to a 2025 McKinsey Global Survey, 71% of organizations are now regularly using generative AI in at least one business function, with workflow automation being the most common application.

### Key Benefits

Companies using AI-powered automation experience up to 40% faster process completion and significant cost savings. These tools enable real-time decision-making through data-driven insights and intelligent routing.

### What Makes AI Workflow Tools Different

AI workflow automation takes traditional automation to the next level by adding intelligence and adaptability to processes that were previously rigid and rule-based, with AI-powered solutions interpreting intent, understanding context, and determining the best response paths independently.

The tools mentioned consistently focus on no-code/low-code approaches, making them accessible to business users without technical expertise, while incorporating advanced AI capabilities like natural language processing, machine learning, and intelligent decision-making to handle complex, dynamic workflows.

## Top AI Workflow Automation Tools for 2025

content.text:
Here are the top AI workflow automation tools for 2025:

**Best Overall Options:**
- **Zapier** - Easiest to start, 6000+ app integrations, AI Copilot for natural language workflow building
- **FlowForma** - AI-powered Copilot, 10x faster process building 
- **Trengo** - Advanced conversation management, smart AI routing
- **Lindy** - No-code AI agents for custom workflows
- **Relay** - Web scraping, human-in-the-loop, advanced AI blocks

**Key Considerations:**
- Market growing 21.5% CAGR ($20B to $78B by 2030)
- 40% faster process completion with AI automation
- Most tools offer no-code/low-code approaches

To give you the best recommendation, what specific workflows do you want to automate? (emails, data processing, customer service, document management, etc.)
